result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby T Neal Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges, including DNA, by 1-13-2017.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
*Credit of 3 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work.  Court stays report date to 1-15-2016 by 5:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bobby T Neal in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties.  

As to Count 1:   Defendant ordered to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work.  Court stays report date to 1-15-2016 by 5:00 pm.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges, including DNA, by 1-13-2017.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Bobby T Neal in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.   Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.
As to Count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  

Defense request to adjourn sentencing, granted by court.  Court vacates jury trial date of 1-13-2016.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bobby T Neal in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing, however, defense unable to proceed on this date and requested a trial date. Defense counsel confident that the matter will be resolved on the final pre-trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bobby T Neal in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense newly appointed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bobby T Neal in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Bobby T Neal Jr
Current: 2503 W. Glendale Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 07-02-2015)
Prior: 2503 W. Glendale Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Bobby T Neal in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.45  for a Pretrial Conference.vb

No appearance by Petitioner.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Brittany Kachingwe.

Return of property hearing on June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
